content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Certainly! In Julia, you can write a function `keep_only_names` that filters out words not starting with a capital letter using list comprehension or the `filter` function. Hereâ€™s an example implementation using list comprehension:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words::Vector{String})::Vector{String}
    return [word for word in words if !isempty(word) && isuppercase(first(word))]
end
```

Alternatively, you can use the `filter` function for a similar effect:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words::Vector{String})::Vector{String}
    return filter(word -> !isempty(word) && isuppercase(first(word)), words)
end
```

Both versions of the function iterate over the list `words`, checking if the first character of each word is uppercase. If the word starts with a capital letter, it is retained in the resulting list. Note that we also take care of empty strings by checking `!isempty(word)`, which ensures words that could cause errors (like out-of-bounds errors when accessing `first(word)`) are not processed.
